meanings.sent1: She glouted at him when he broke her favorite toy.
meanings.sent2: The teacher glouted at the noisy students in the classroom.
meanings.sent3: The cat glouted at the dog who stole its treat.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds glouted down at the small village below.
meanings.sent5: His glouting eyes made everyone uncomfortable in the room.

meanings.definition: To look or gaze with displeasure
meanings.sent1: The customer glouted at the rude waiter who ignored him.
meanings.sent2: She glouted at the messy room before starting to clean.
meanings.sent3: The baby glouted at the vegetables on his plate.
meanings.sent4: The old man's eyes glouted disapprovingly at the noisy street.
meanings.sent5: The teacher glouted at the unfinished homework on the desk.

meanings.definition: To frown or scowl in an angry or sullen manner
meanings.sent1: He glouted at his brother for eating the last cookie.
meanings.sent2: The boss glouted at the employees who were late for the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The grumpy neighbor glouted at the kids playing in the yard.
meanings.sent4: The villain's face glouted with malice as he planned his next move.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds glouted over the desolate landscape.
